item.description:
Issue with directions.
Fred said that google directions put us at the wrong place. See his picture to determine where to go.

http://www.lunaulive....






Rescheduled from last week

Our next adventure in hiking with dogs will be at Hurd State Park in East Hampton, CT. on Sunday.

Note: This hike is a Saturday hike. (We will have more Sunday hikes planned)

This park is a designated "walk-in" facility. Parking is available near the gate at the intersection of Route 151 and Hurd Park Road. (We will try parking there instead of the main gate to avoid some of the people)
(250 Moodus Rd, East Hampton, Middlesex, Connecticut 06424)


DEP Website
http://www.ct.gov/Dep...


Trail Map
http://www.ct.gov/dep...

Google Directions
http://maps.google.co...


Directions Per the State Website

From the North: I-91 south. Take Exit 20 (left exit) onto Route 9. Take a right onto Route 66 and follow Route 66. Take a right onto Route 151. Hurd State Park is on the right.

From the South: I-95 north. Take Exit 69 onto Route 9 north. Take Exit 7 and proceed on Route 82 across the East Haddam Bridge. Continue on Route 82 and take a left onto Route 151. Follow Route 151. Hurd State Park is on the left.

From the East: I-395 South to Route 2. Follow Route 2 west to Route 16. Follow Route 16 west to Cobalt. Take a left onto Route 151. Follow Route 151. Hurd State Park is on the right.

From the West: I-84 east. Take Exit 27 onto I-691. Follow I-691, which becomes Route 66. From Route 66 take a right onto Route 151. Hurd State Park is on the right.
item.how_to_find_us: I will be in the parking lot with a Blue Ford Edge
item.name: Hurd State Park
